intro: Psychotria fadyenii, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red when ripe. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Psychotria fadyenii is notable for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids and other bioactive compounds.
